newsitem.title: UK: NWE gasoline barges weaker, contango helps cargoes.
newsitem.headline: NWE gasoline barges weaker, contango helps cargoes.

text.p: NWE prompt gasoline barge prices were weaker pressured by hedge related selling, while the market's short term contango steadied cargo prices, traders said.
"There are several cargoes showing but the short term contango favours the sellers," a trader said. "The market will stay on hold for a while until people see how U.S. demand pans out in May".

Though several cargoes were seen available, traders said the sellers were reluctant to put a price on them due to the current lack of buying interest. Premium unleaded was assessed notionally stable around $196/$197 a tonne cif NWE.
On the key ARA barge market prices for balance of April liftings were under some pressure with one trade house selling the market lower as a hedge against a swaps position.
A barge loading April 25 was heard sold down to $188.25 a tonne fob ARA nearly $3 under the previous trade. Early May liftings faired slightly better slipping only $1 to trade at $193 a tonne.
